title.rendered: New York intellectual property law firm launches new website.

content.rendered:
Boag IP, a New York, NY intellectual property law firm, has launched a new website created by Dan Gilroy Design. The updated website features a fresh law firm web design, easy-to-use navigation, and clear information about the firm’s legal services pertaining to patents, trademarks, and copyrights.

I cannot say enough about my experience with Dan Gilroy Design. Dan is a thoughtful, patient, creative, and attentive professional and I’m thrilled with the end product. That Dan is a genuinely nice guy and a pleasure to work with was an added bonus. Highly recommend.

David Boag

A few of the highlights include:

  • Photography. Black and white images of iconic buildings and neighborhood landmarks were curated to appeal to international, national, and local intellectual property clients alike.
  • Overall Look and Feel. The new website is clean and uncluttered, but not barren.  The color scheme – blue, white, black, and shades of gray – coupled with the images makes for a visually engaging website.
  • Good Use of FAQ Pages. An intellectual property law website is the perfect candidate for FAQ pages. In the case of Boag IP, we created individual FAQ pages for each specific practice area category, namely, patents, trademark, copyrights, and licensing.
  • Easy-To-Use Navigation. Every section – bio, practice areas, and FAQs – are within one click. It doesn’t get much easier than that.

David Boag, the founder of Boag IP, helps clients with difficult and complex intellectual property problems. As a former software developer, he can easily bridge law and technology, delivering exceptional value to his high-tech clients. David has a wide range of experience representing clients in federal court and before the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office, including the Patent Trial and Appeal Board and Trademark Trial and Appeal Board.

Visit Website Our Portfolio
